Factsheet

Developer:
Ben Thomas
Based in Berkeley, CA
Release date:
9/19/2016
Platforms:
Itch.io (Playable in Browser)
Website:
freebrunch.itch.io/colony-collapse-disorder
Regular Price:
Free

Description

Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD) is a procedurally generated adventure game where you play as an Oakland bee scouring a flower field. You must maintain honey reserves, navigate randomized encounters, and most importantly produce Queen Bees.

History

How it Started

The first programming I ever learned was through an online web development certification. I learned html, css. and some javascript for making simple web pages. And even though these aren't traditional game development tools, I was sure gonna try and make a game with them!

Point and Click

One of the tutorials I was doing for my web development classes was a javascript framwork called "Knockout.js". And Knockout.js had a core feature called "Automatic UI Refresh - When your data model's state changes, your UI updates automatically". Sounds like a game engine right?? I realized I could assign data to css elements on a page and manipulate all the elements on the page based on click information.

BEES

I now had a dynamic single page canvas on which to create my game from. I was obsessed with becoming a beekeeper at the time so I thought it would be cool to go on an adventure as a bee in my game. I combined elements from point-and-click adventure games and roguelike games and my imagination ran wild. I created a hexagonal "flower field" grid for the player to click through. And I drew comical random events to stumble upon. I even hooked up a live weather API for Oakland, CA (where I was living at the time) for that sweet sweet "immersion". CCD was born. I shared with my friends and family and was giddy that I had actually made a playable game. Still so proud of it to this day.

Features

  • Playable in browser
  • Global high score leaderboard
  • Live weather
  • Artful, high fidelity visuals to immerse you in the adventure
  • Visit local flowers every step of the way

Game Monetization
Ben Thomas allows for the contents of Colony Collapse Disorder to be published through video broadcasting services for any commercial or non-commercial purposes. Monetization of videos created containing assets from Colony Collapse Disorder is legally and explicitly allowed by Ben Thomas .
